title: Toyah's Murder: What we know so far | ABC NEWS
description: You can't spend too long in Far North Queensland without spotting a bumper sticker bearing the name "Toyah".   This week, The Case Of is in Cairns to follow the long-awaited trial for Toyah Cordingley's alleged killer, Rajwinder Singh.   Rajwinder Singh, 41, has pleaded not guilty to one count of murder.   In this episode, ABC Far North Queensland reporter Christopher Testa and Stephen Stockwell talk through what we know about the case so far, as jury selection begins.   If you have any questions about this trial you'd like Chris and Stocky to answer in future episodes, please email thecaseof@abc.net.au (mailto:thecaseof@abc.net.au) .   The Case Of is the follow-up to the hit podcast Mushroom Case Daily, and all episodes of that show will remain available in the back catalogue of The Case Of.

title: Engineer warns apartments at risk of collapse if NT government does not act | ABC NEWS
description: A respected engineer says around 80 per cent of apartment buildings he's inspected in Darwin have serious structural problems  John Brears has managed some of the NT's most iconic construction projects and is now calling on the NT government to act on the issue.  Mr Brears says if the issues are not addressed properly, some buildings could collapse. Jack Hislop has this report for Stateline Northern Territory. title: BBC bosses resign over misleading edit of Donald Trump documentary | ABC NEWS
description: The BBC has announced director-general Tim Davie and head of news Deborah Turness have resigned. It comes amid criticism that the broadcaster’s Panorama documentary misled viewers by editing a speech by Donald Trump before protesters attacked the US Capitol on January 6, 2021. title: Super Typhoon Fung Wong hits Philippines a week after deadly Kalmaegi | ABC NEWS
description: Super typhoon Fung Wong has made landfall in the Philippines just a week after the deadly typhoon Kalmaegi hit the country. At least two people have been killed while more than a million people are displaced. title: Parents of slain Israeli hostage call for inquiry into October 7 attacks | ABC NEWS
description: The parents of a slain Israeli hostage have pledged to continue fighting for a national inquiry into how Hamas’s deadly October 7 attacks were allowed to occur. Middle East Correspondent Matthew Doran reports there are fears Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is attempting to narrow the scope of a potential probe to obfuscate his personal responsibility. title: Why crypto ATMs are a scammer’s best friend | ABC News Daily podcast
description: We want to hear from you! Please complete our survey: 2025 ABC News Daily Audience Survey (https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=mkDBl3hw50e7lNHlNQPgEpOxE0YscZ5Au4rK0pnU0zpURUxPU0ZaM0g0M1NaSEg4QVFVUFFKMVc4Uy4u)    You may have noticed a crypto ATM in the corner of a shopping centre or in a convenience store.    There are thousands of them, tapping into investor’s interest around booming markets for bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies.   But increasingly crypto ATMs are being used by criminals to launder money and to scam Australians out of millions of dollars.   Today, business reporter Rhiana Whitson on why feeding cash into a crypto ATM can be so risky and why there’s so little regulation of the market.    Featured:    Rhiana Whitson, ABC business reporter

title: Students caught in the crossfire as Adelaide universities merge | ABC NEWS
description: It's the biggest merger of its type in the nation’s history. From late next month, the University of Adelaide and the University of South Australia will begin to cease operations and transform to become Adelaide University. The new uni is projected to be home to about 70,000 students and 11,000 staff, but as the clock ticks, some are being caught in the crossfire. title: Evacuations ordered as Typhoon Fung-wong slams into the Philippines | ABC NEWS
description: Super Typhoon Fung-wong has made landfall on the north-eastern coast of the Philippines. It's the biggest typhoon to slam into the country in years, forcing more than a million people to evacuate their homes in landslide-prone areas. Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr has declared a state of emergency, with at least two people killed in the storm. title: Women’s pain inquiry finds gender bias in healthcare system | ABC NEWS
description: Victoria's Inquiry into Women's Pain has found a dismissive and disrespectful healthcare system built around "Caucasian male biology" is contributing to poorer outcomes for women and girls. CEO of Women's Health Victoria Sally Hasler says it’s a “significant moment”, calling for more action to combat bias in the health system. title: Surge in renewable energy providing power surplus | ABC NEWS
description: A surge in renewable energy has meant some sources are being switched off due to too much power in the system or not enough demand in the market. Some solar farms on Australia's eastern seabord are losing as much as 30 per cent of their potential production to curtailment.
